Name: innsbruck spiel
Description:
From the Golden Roof to the Hafelekar.
The joyable quiz about local knowledge for everybody who wants to know Innsbruck better.
 Travel with you pawn trough the city districts up to the mountain answering questions about culture, sports, nature, history and play some "Activity-actions".
—user summary

Vom Goldenen Dach'l zum Hafelekar
Das vergnügliche Wissensqiuz für alle, die Innsbruck noch besser kennenlernen möchten.
—description from the box

Name: Star Wars: Legion – Anakin Skywalker Commander Expansion
Description:
Anakin Skywalker is one of the enduring heroes of the Clone Wars. Whether he is leading troops into battle or personally engaging the enemy using his mastery of the Djem So form of lightsaber combat, he will do what must be done to protect the Republic, even if it leads to temptation by the dark side.

This expansion includes everything you need to have Anakin Skywalker take command of your Republic armies. The beautifully detailed, unpainted hard plastic miniature can be assembled in one of two poses while his three signature command cards allow him to tap into even more power as the battle goes on. Finally, six upgrade cards invite you to explore Skywalker's full potential while his new flawed card provides enemies a weakness to exploit.

—description from the publisher

Name: Star Wars: Legion – Darth Maul and Sith Probe Droids Operative Expansion
Description:
Fueled by his hatred, Darth Maul operates in the shadows, seeking the right moment to take his revenge on the Jedi. This master of the Juyo form of lightsaber combat wields his iconic double-bladed lightsaber to great effect as his Sith probe droids help him hone in on his next target.

With this expansion, you can dispatch Darth Maul and his Sith probe droids to do your bidding. The beautifully detailed, unpainted Darth Maul miniature can be assembled in three distinct poses while his three signature command cards make him a particularly versatile fighter. Finally, eight upgrade cards let you fully fully explore his dark power.

—description from the publisher

Name: System Gate
Description:
System Gate is a living card game where two or more players race to reduce their opponent's life to zero. They do this by playing monster, spell, item and finale cards.

There are three spaces on the board - left, center, and right - that monsters can be placed. If there is no monster in a player's center space, they are vulnerable to attack. Players can equip item cards to give them an edge.

There are several factions, called worlds, each specializing in a unique strategy and gameplay.

—description from the designer

Name: FCK CDL KLL
Description:
FCK CDL KLL is a card game of brains and silliness where you find yourself searching for a sharkpig having sex with a pregnant angel or a unicorn killing a yellow snowman or a former president cuddling with the devil.

On a 3x3 tableau of 9 cards, players attempt to create a "Perfect 9" by playing 3 horizontal Trifectas and 3 vertical Trifectas - a Trifecta being 3 cards in a row or column containing the same character. There are 3 "suits" of card FCK, CDL, and KLL and 11 different characters.

A Horizontal Trifecta must have all three suits of card (FCK+CDL+KLL) and a Vertical Trifecta must have all the same suit (i.e., KLL+KLL+KLL)

Each round player may either switch 1 card from the middle tableau of 9 cards to their own tableau of 9 cards or add 9 more cards to the middle.

Additional turns may be gained by achieving a "Holy Trifecta" in which the same two characters appear three times in a row.

FCK cards can be used to switch cards from tableaus of their opponents.

Name: Know Nine?
Description:
Get ready for the fast-paced lateral thinking game that will make your palms sweat, your brain buzz, and your mouth ramble!

Link all the words on the grid, but be quick, you’ve only got a minute!

Only unique answers count and you’ll need to use your powers of persuasion to score.

Your competitors decide if your answers are allowed, so you need to be convincing when you argue your case.

Do you know nine, and will you score at all?!

—description from the publisher

Name: Brocken
Description:
Brocken is the second of a trilogy of games from the Japanese group áš« áš± á› á›– á›— á› á›‹ á› áš« (Artemisia), which centre around the Witches' Sabbath, Walpurgis Night. Brocken is the highest peak in the Harz mountains in northern Germany. In folklore, it was the gathering place for witches to celebrate their rites (Goethe writes of it in his work Faust).

In this game, three witches must travel to Brocken to join their coven. Having already prepared their flying potions in the previous game, they now fly using a chair, a broomstick and a goat to carry them. They must pass through the perilous woodlands and swamps, and avoid the spiders.

The game is for three players only. Each player has a deck of cards, each showing a rune. There is a set of three dice, also with the runes. One player throws the dice, and the players must try to match the runes thrown with their hand cards. This allows them to move across the forest, as the cards each have special actions (such as move three places, or bring other witches to you).

The first player to successful get to the peak at Brocken is the winner.
user summary

Name: Vorbereitung zur Walpurgisnacht
Description:
Vorbereitung zur Walpurgisnacht is the first of a trilogy of witchcraft games from the Japanese coterie circle áš« áš± á› á›– á›— á› á›‹ á› áš« (Artemisia). The game is for three players only, and has the three witches concocting their flying potions, to be used in the successive game Brocken, when they fly for Walpurgisnacht.

The original game has a trifold game board of thick card, with different sections to complete the potions. There is a large deck of cards for the ingredients (frogs, Nightshade, Wormwood and so on). There are also some coloured minerals used as markers, and the game was delivered in a cloth pouch.

The later edition is boxed and upgraded to a wooden board and a d4 die is added, along with an ingredients card.

Players use the cards from their hand to collect the ingredients and brew their potion. The first witch to succeed wins the game and takes flight to Brocken...
user summary

Name: Circino: le Chasseur de Trésors – Destination Yvelines
Description:
Circino A Treasure Hunt in the Yvelines

From Versailles à Sartrouville, via Rambouillet, Trappes, Chambourcy etc ... 36 municipalities of the "78" department will occupy a central and predominant spot in the game.

Goal of the game
The players select 8 "Objective" cards (= 8 communes) and they collect the 8 "Objective" pellets corresponding to these 8 cards. They shuffle them face down then place them on the different chests on the game board.

Each player then collects at random or he chooses 2 "Objective" cards among the 8 selected.

The goal of the game will consist in finding the 2 “Objective” pellets corresponding to his 2 cards then in bringing them back the 1st to Circino in the center of the board ... with as only weapons the dice and his sense of adventure!

In their quest, players will not be alone and can count on the help of members of the Circino family through Bonus Cards.

Name: Ticinum: Il gioco di Pavia
Description:
In Ticinum: Il gioco di Pavia you get to buy the most popular streets and squares in the city, then increase their value by building houses, churches and towers.

You can graduate by passing through the University, thus gaining unique powers to change the tide of the game.

The event cards are comparable to those of Monopoly and represent historical commercial activities and monuments.

The pawns are personalized: Bonarda, salami, barcè, fog and mosquitoes.

Instead of Euros, the currency is "franchises".

The primary purpose of the game is the enhancement of the city of Pavia.

This game was also created to fight gambling; in 2013 Pavia was described by the New York Times as the capital of gambling.

Name: Design By Committee
Description:
Design by Committee is a competitive/cooperative game of product development. Every player will work to achieve both their own, individual Requirements as well as the Requirements of the product as a whole.

Gameplay advances over the course of multiple games. You earn or lose points each game depending on the outcome of the product and your overall success in simultaneously achieving your own personal goals. The first player to earn 50 or more total points (as an ongoing score across multiple games) is the winner. There is no minimum score, players can freely go into negative numbers.

—description from the designer

Name: Cat-Tastic
Description:
Owning a cat is full of adventure, and many unexpected things can happen along the way--so get ready!  Be the first to collect six hearts by showing how well you care for cats, and win!
—description from the back of the box

Cat-Tastic plays on a roll-and-move board with spaces along the perimeter (picture monopoly).  The various spaces either cause you to gain or lose money, or draw a card with an event, or adopt a cat to gain a heart.  The cards generally require you to pay money to a specific business (or to the bank if the business is not owned), with some of the cards rewarding a heart afterwards.

At the start of the game, you choose a cat care business to own (two businesses in a 2 player game), like vet, or groomer.  The business will interact with some of the event cards, and may also have a cost to maintain.  You may also purchase additional businesses during the game.

As long as you don't go bankrupt, you go around the board and collect hearts until someone wins by collecting 6 hearts.

—user summary

Name: Deutschland Reise
Description: Discover Germany by playing, what can be done faster? First visit Winnetou in Bad Segeberg and then visit the largest wine barrel in the world in Heidelberg? Or first to the cathedral in Cologne? The players from Deutschlandreise go on an exciting and informative journey across Germany. The goal: Visit eight cities and be the first to return to the pre-determined starting point. The players plan an ideal travel route for this. You can expect over two hundred sights such as the Brandenburg Gate or interesting towns such as Rothenburg ob der Tauber. These are presented to you in words and pictures. With interesting action cards your own journey can be accelerated or that of the other players slowed down! With good planning, a bit of luck with the dice and the clever use of your action cards, you will be the first to end the exciting journey through Germany.

Name: Tru Action Electric Baseball Game
Description: Tru Action Electric Baseball Game is a baseball game in which the batter uses a spring-loaded flipper to toss a magnet from behind home plate and onto the metal board to determine the results of a pitch. The board has marked areas to show hits and outs while landing on a line is a strike and between marked areas is a ball. If the batter gets a hit, they can flip a switch to vibrate the board and their batter will start to run the bases. They can stop when they reach base — but when a hit occurs, the fielder uses their flipper from behind the outfield to try to throw out runners as they head for the next base.

Name: Puppy Trek
Description:
Players race puppies through a Pacific Northwest inspired whimsical gameboard.

In this D6 roll-to-move, players weigh tradeoffs between pausing to pick up more resource cards and pushing through, racing to reach home first. Cards allow additional movement or setting rivals back on the path, at limited opportunities. Cards and special board spaces involve the players performing simple no-stakes in-the-real-world physical (e.g., hop like a frog) and mental (e.g., answer a question or spell a word) activities.

Name: Dino Battle: Logical Game.
Description:
Long ago, in the Mesozoic era, dinosaurs dominated the Earth for many millions of years. They fought for survival in the thriving prehistoric jungle and evolved in constant battle with their own kind.

The game Dino Battle invites you to make an exciting journey into the era of dinosaurs and by choosing your own kind - lead it to dominance on the planet! Build a colony of your kind in a winning combination or don't let your opponent do it. The logic battle will not leave indifferent any player!

During each round, players take turns laying out the tiles of creatures of their kind on the board, trying to fulfill the conditions of victory. As soon as one of the players fulfills them, the round ends immediately:

Plants
They win when they manage to build a straight line vertically, horizontally, or diagonally from 5 consecutively placed tiles of their kind.

Ceratops
They win when they manage to build a straight line vertically, horizontally, or diagonally from 4 consecutively placed tiles of their kind.

T-Rexes
They win when they manage to build a straightline vertically, horizontally, or diagonally from 3consecutively placed tiles of their kind.

Pterodactyls
They win when they lay out the 5th tile of their kind on the board, regardless of the relative position of these tiles.

Name: Taskmaster Game: Expansion Pack
Description:
Welcome to the TASKMASTER Game Expansion Pack!

Inside this box, you will get:


     40 all-new task cards to add to your Taskmaster Board Game
     The opportunity to access exclusive Final Video Tasks
     10 Prize Task selector cards
     50 paper refill slips for your stunning self-portraits
     Your very own little Taskmaster’s Assistant!

Name: The American Professional Football Game, 1920-1949
Description:
The American Professional Football Game, 1920-1949, is a print-and-play solitaire educational board game that teaches you the history of professional football from the inception of the American Professional Football Association in 1920 through the National Football League’s 1949 gridiron season.

Your goal is to help professional football survive and thrive by spending Moxie points and attempting to activate inactive teams, stabilize unstable teams, hire and move players and other contributors to teams, lobby for new stadiums, and scout out new independent professional teams. You must also play exhibition games to help those independent professional teams earn the Bona Fide status and to earn more Moxie points.

—description from the designer

Name: Mi Butto... O Non Mi Butto...
Description: Mi Butto... O Non Mi Butto is a card game in which players are trying to create sets of cards that contains: one sky card, one plane card and one paratrooper card. When a set is complete you can add a "landing" card to score points. Other players can try to block your sets using their cards. At the end of the game, the player with the most points, wins.

Name: Le Grand Jeu: Alix
Description:
A family strategy game accessible to all: those who already love the world of Alix and those who are discovering it!

         From 2 to 3 players individually,
          From 4 to 6 players in a team.
    



     Set off on a race through the Roman Empire to visit the cities to which Rome sends you on missions.
     Stop off in the great cities of the ancient world and be the first to return to Rome once your missions are completed
     Use strategy and beware of your opponents or the twists of fate. 


May the gods be with you!

Name: Hardwar: Advanced Warfare – World Introduction
Description:
This is the introduction to the world of Hardwar.

Hardwar is a fast-paced tactical combat game set in plausible future of dawning 22nd century - a blend of dystopia and utopia in which nations are squeezed by the pressure of super-powerful corporations, and yet space travel beyond the borders of our solar system lies tentatively within our grasp. Many challenges of disease and poverty seem to have been overcome, yet the megawealthy continue to treat the world as a playground that bends to their whim.

In such an environment, full-blown war is rare. But small, secretive conflicts of fierce intensity are commonplace and corporations employ “security forces” with access to top-level military hardware in numbers that would put many smaller nations’ militaries to shame.

—description from the publisher

Name: Vikings Gone Wild: Saga Mega Expansión
Description:
Each turn in Vikings Gone Wild — a deck-building, resource management game based on the online real-time strategy game — players can either buy permanent buildings sitting in front of them (resource factories, resources containers, etc) or buy units, towers and special cards that improve their deck and offense/defense capacity.

The only way to win is by successfully attacking each other, and each attack involves interesting bluffing mechanisms in which the attacker doesn't know the defense capacity of their opponent...

This compilation contains the four expansions of the game: Masters of Elements, Ragnarok!, Guild Wars, and It's a Kind of Magic.

Name: Order-Up: Burger Edition
Description: Order-Up: Burger Edition is a fast, fun, burger-matching card game that is perfect for the whole family. Race against your fellow cooks to complete five orders, but don't forget to yell "Order-Up!"

Name: Raus aus'm Loch!
Description:
Each player gets ten tokens (white or black) and two dice. The two players move in opposite directions. White beginns to roll the dice and the players set their tokens on spaces one to six (two tokens for each roll, first the lower number, than the higher one). If all tokens are placed in section I the tokens are moved into section II and III according to the roll of the dice. From now on only one token may be placed on a space. Only when the lower number may be used the higher number may be used too. If doubles are rolled, the upper numbers are used first, then the numbers on the bottom of the dice. The goal is to move all tokens through section IV. Spaces 19 to 24 may only be occupied by two tokens at the same time, when empty.

The first player who manages to occupy three spaces in section IV with at least two tokens each, wins half the contents of the cash box.

The first player to get all his tokens out of the game (beyond space 24) wins the game and the rest of the contents of the cash box.

—user summary

Name: Würfelkitschen
Description:
A dice action game in a wooden box with a felt carpet in it. Target of the game is to get as much point after 12 rounds by throwing dices in the wooden box to manipulate own dices and dices of all other players.

There are special rules for single player game or 2 player game, too.

—user summary

Name: Carnival Zoo
Description:
Dressing a hippopotamus or a rhino for the Grand Ball of animals is not easy, especially if you want to be the first to do so.

A fun game teaching to think, recognize shapes, and appreciate the beauty of colors.

Use the spinning wheel to find out the color of the square you're moving to. Pick up the shape you see in that square, and put it on your animal to dress it.

The first to dress completely his animal, wins.

translated from the Italian box cover

Name: トゥルーマリンショー2 (True Marine Show 2)
Description:
Marine may have gathered her sailors and put herself back together again, but now Space Marine appears from another dimension. The journey to collect characters from Azur Lane, Touhou Project, and hololive begins anew.

Play sailors from your hand to gain Vtuber Points (VP) in order to purchase more powerful sailors from the market and improve your deck. This time around, many abilities focus on removing cards from your deck as the game goes on in order to perform more powerful actions and get extra VP. The game ends at the end of the round when a player reaches 20 or more VP. Whoever has the most VP is the winner.
Families: Video Game Theme: Project Shrine Maiden

Name: Escape Game: Disney Villains
Description:
The villains of the Disney universe are unleashed! Jafar, Maleficent, Ursula, Hades and the Queen of Hearts are ready to do anything to carry out their Machiavellian plans. Play as Disney's bravest heroes and heroines and travel from Wonderland to Agrabah to complete your quest.

The Escape Room range is inspired by the Escape Room rooms. Find their incredible atmosphere at home! Go on an adventure, observe, manipulate and solve various puzzles that will put your logical mind to the test. Uncover fantastic puzzles, travel through legendary landscapes from Disney films and overcome the five big villains!

This Escape Game contains 5 scenarios of 60 minutes each.

Name: Трикветр
Description:
Nano game on one card (board on a side, rules on the other side) for two players. You need to provide four D6 dices.
It's a simple game with a math mechanic. The Players will do manipulations with dices and try to catch the opponent when he can’t do his move. On the player's turn, he can change the dice value downside or place another dice. But be careful, each field have a special number, so you can’t change a value lower than this number. A player who can't do his turn loses this game. 
KOZAK Games Publishing shared this game as a gift for their customers in 2020 (COVID-19 Pandemic)

Name: Шифр
Description:
Nano game on one card (board on a side, rules on the other side) for two players or more. For playing this game you also need to provide mobile phone or paper with pen for each player. Each player get the encrypted code from another player and try to decode it. It's a simple game with an encryption mechanic.

KOZAK Games Publishing shared this game as a gift for their customers in 2020 (COVID-19 Pandemic).
Contained in Casual Game Insider Magazine CGI#42(2023).

Name: Ale Pary: Misz Masz
Description: Ale Pary: Misz Masz features gameplay identical to that of Spot it! 1,2,3, with the game consisting of 31 cards, each showing six images. Any two cards have exactly one image in common, and your challenge when playing is to spot what that matching image is before anyone else.

Name: Rick and Morty: Find the Morty
Description:
Roll the dice, then be the first to grab the right Morty!

Place the 36 Morty cards on a table, then roll the dice to give a Morty species, effect and accessory. The first player to grab the correct Morty wins the round.  Be the first player to grab 5 Mortys to win the game!

Name: Junior Colourbrain
Description:
Junior Colourbrain is a colourful quiz for kids where they get all the answers before they start, and they’re all colours!

All the questions are based on things kids should know but adults might struggle with, such as, “What colour are Strawberry Millions?”

Using the 11 Colour Cards in your hand, players put down the correct colour (or colours) to win the card. If it’s a draw, it starts a rollover! Play the correct colours and your team can race ahead with the points... as long as some of the other teams get it wrong. First to reach 10 points, wins!
Families: Versions & Editions: Junior Versions of Grown-Up Games

Name: Happy Cats
Description:
You will need all your wits about you to come out on top in this game of competing cats.

Fluffy balls as far as the eye can see – a paradise for all cats! But make no mistake: none of them want to share. Each cat tries to grab as many of the fluffy balls as possible. But who will succeed with their clever card play?

The aim of the game is to collect as many fluffy balls as possible and end up with the most points – with some skillful card play.

The game ends when the last fluffy ball is taken.

The player with the highest total score wins.

Name: Jeu de l'Oie: Les Salamandres de Beauvais
Description:
The Salamanders of Beauvais is a trivia-goose game that lets you discover the city of Beauvais in northern France. 
As in the goose game there is chance, a maze, traps, a prison... 
but also, as in Trivial Pursuit, questions, 330 that allow players to progress in the game on sport, history, cinema ... 
It contains 62 boxes illustrated with old photos of the streets and monuments of Beauvais or of its outstanding personalities.

However, you can count on the help of the magic Salamander to progress in the game...

Name: ひつじの国のアリス (Hitsuji no kuni no Alice)
Description:
ã²ã¤ã˜ã®å›½ã®ã‚¢ãƒªã‚¹ (Hitsuji no kuni no Alice) is a game from Japan, where Alice causes trouble in the Land Of Sheep.

Alice suddenly appears in the Land Of Sheep, which is ruled by the Queen of Sheep. Alice behaves poorly! She enters somebody's house and eats their cookies without permission, and goes into another house and drinks without permission too! She ruins a tea party, disturbs the Queen's cricket match, and so on!

Finally, Alice promised to leave, but only if she was given lots of souvenirs to take home.

In the game, the players use white sheep to collect souvenirs for Alice. The game is a semi-co-operative game, with players working together to get Alice out, but also competing to provide the most popular souvenirs.

As Alice moves around, different souvenir tokens appear on the game board. Players place their sheep tiles adjacent to the tokens they want to collect. The highest value sheep will take the token, using a 'butting' mechanism, like  Hols der Geier, with equal values cancelling out. Players also have black sheep, which can trump the white sheep of equal value.

The best souvenirs score the most points, but Alice is fickle and her tastes change as she progresses along the path. The souvenirs are ranked, but the order of their rank changes during the game.

When she finally reaches the gate, the game ends. Once the final score is determined, players turn up the ending cards, and discover what kind of end the Land Of Sheep has.
user summary

Name: Secrets of Emerald Hill: A Murder Mystery Game
Description:
At the outer reaches of London's most sought-after postcode sits Emerald Hill, the city's highly exclusive gated community. When Mr. Addington, the snobbish owner of the estate, is found dead on the marble floor of his en suite bathroom, it's clear that his death was no accident. Each of the residents, from Tiffany the VHS fitness queen to Keith the daytime soap heartthrob, is hiding an explosive secret, but only one of them would go so far as to kill in order to protect that secret!

Set in the 80s, when hair was big and shoulder pads were bigger, this immersive murder mystery will see you and your fellow dinner guests become both murder suspects and detectives for the evening. Will you be able to unravel the clues, pinpoint the motives and solve the murder before coffee is served?

Name: よくばりハンターズ！ (Greedy Hunters!)
Description:
ã‚ˆãã°ã‚Šãƒãƒ³ã‚¿ãƒ¼ã‚ºï¼ (Greedy Hunters!) is a traitor game from Japan. The players work together, exploring a dangerous dungeon, and try to recover the treasures within. But when the party tries to leave, then the traitors try to gain the upper hand.

At the start of the game, the players are dealt a secret hidden role; either they are Hunters, or Greedy. As the players explore the dungeon, battling monsters and avoiding traps, a player's special abilities might reveal what their true character.

Players draw action cards and play through similar to a role-playing game. When the dungeon is cleared, as the players climb out, the Greedy traitors try to steal from the others. At the end of the game, the richest Hunter and the richest Greedy both win.
user summary

Name: 箱庭キングス (Hakoniwa Kings)
Description:
ç®±åº­ã‚­ãƒ³ã‚°ã‚¹ (Hakinowa Kings) is a game from Japan themed around the seasons, with cards representing people from kingdoms that identify with Spring, Summer, Fall, and Winter. Players use cards like workers in a worker placement game. An opening card draft allows you to build a winning strategy from the very beginning.

Players compete to accumulate 15 resource points or construct 3 buildings to win. All players begin with the same 4 unbuilt buildings and 6 drafted cards. Buildings not only lead to a possible victory, they also provide helpful bonuses as long as they remain complete. Each turn progresses through 4 phases: the Seasonal Phase, Construction Phase, Action Phase, and End Phase.

In the Seasonal Phase, players take different actions depending on the season marked on the Season Board. In Spring, players gain a free card. In Summer, players can build for free. In Fall, players gain free resource points. And in Winter, players reduce the resource points or hurt the buildings of unprotected players.

In the Construction Phase, buildings that are partially built will progress on their own. Players may also spend a resource point to help one building along. In the Action Phase, players will play Action Cards. Some cards can only be played in certain seasons or when players have completed certain buildings. If no player has reached a victory condition in the End Phase, players continue with the next season.

Choose your cards wisely as you decide your path to victory!

user summary

Name: Räuber der Nordsee: Held Mico
Description:
1 x Hero: Mico

Mico gains 1 Strength for each previously raided Fortress
Families: Series: The North Sea Trilogy (Garphill Games)

Name: Räuber der Nordsee: Steinmetz & Wachmann
Description:
2 x Steinmetz (Stone Mason)
2 x Wachmann (Watchman)
Families: Series: The North Sea Trilogy (Garphill Games)

Name: Six Gun Sound: Devil's Elbow
Description:
Rob banks like Jesse James...enforce the law like Wyatt Earp...or maybe find something in between. If they did it, so can you with Six Gun Sound. With over 15 unique "professions" Six Gun Sound lets you experience the Wild West to the fullest.

Six Gun Sound is a fast paced set of "cowboy" rules that allows you to refight history or make your own. Whether you choose to fight a "one up" battle or string together a series of adventures, Six Gun Sound can do it all. Six Gun Sound is easy to learn yet entertaining for both veteran and novice players.

Set in the Old West from 1876-85 Six Gun Sound covers the Lincoln County War, the unpleasantness in Tombstone, the "Demise of the James Younger Gang," and the Great Sioux War of 76 as well as the founding of Deadwood and the death of Bill Hickok. And did we mention Apaches?

Six Gun Sound allows you to either fight unrelated gunfights or link them all together with a seamless and easy to use Campaign System. Watch your characters grow as they advance in skill making their way through the Old West. Bank robberies, cattle rustling, jail breaks, range wars, and more are at your finger tips with Six Gun Sound.

Six Gun Sound works with ANY figures you may already have and in any scale! Play solo, play on the same side, or play head-to-head -- it's your choice. So pop in your favorite Western movie and saddle up for adventure. And remember --- JUST PLAY THE GAME!

Name: Spouse-ology 2nd Edition
Description:
How to play:


     Make sure each couple has an answer board, one dry erase marker, and three Off Script tokens to share.
     The game is played in rounds. For the first round, each couple will answer an "Ask Her question Ladies first
     Choose a couple to go first
     The couple who goes first will roll the die to see which category question to answer from the "Ask Her" card.
     The couple reads the designated question aloud, along with the multiple choice answers
     Each husband writes the answer he believes his wife will choose (A, B, C, D. or E) on his answer board. The couples will take tums revealing their answers by each wife announcing her answer verbally-followed by her husband presenting his written answer to the group.
     Matching answers earn 1 point, or 2 points with a 2x roll, or 3 points when an Off Script token is used.
     The couple to the left rolls next!
     On to round two.



                    
                
            
        
    


Couples should not talk when being asked a question or while writing their answers, and they should be certain written answers cannot be seen by their spouse until it is time to reveal their answers. Have fun!

Off Script-After hearing the question, but before answering it, the couple has the option of choosing to use one of their three "Off Script" tokens to triple their point potential for that turn by selecting "E." A matching answer is worth 3 points

Wild Card - The couple who rolls the Wild Card chooses the category for the table for that round.

Double points-All correct answers will be worth 2 points intead of 1, and the couple rolls again to determine the category. (If the Wild Card is rolled again, they may choose the category, and if they roll the 2x again, they may roll yet again until they get a category rall.)

3 Ways to Win! Be the: 1) 1st couple to score 3 points in each category or 2) couple with the most points after a designated number of rounds or 3) couple with the most points at the end of a designated time frame

Name: Friends: Draw It
Description:
This fun game is your chance to show off your love for all things Friends The Television Series, and how well you can bring to life what is on the card before the time runs out.
Everything you need is supplied for you and your friends to play this fast-paced fun game. Includes a sand timer, 2x pencils, a pad of paper and 50x question cards. Draw and guess what's written on the cards. 
Why not gather your friends and family at your next game night or party and bring out the Friends Draw It game. Supplied in a closed printed box for easy storage and also makes a great gift for fans of this iconic comedy series.

—description from the publisher

Name: King's Archer
Description: A card game in which you swiftly assemble the three hallmarks of a great archer...the bow, the arrow and the heart! Players build three numerical sequences from their hand - the archer’s bow, archer’s arrow and archer’s heart - laying them down on the table as they are achieved. Sequences of all one color or without wild cards are more valuable. Players can disrupt one another’s sequences with thieves - stealing cards right out from underneath their opponents. Players need good judgement to weigh the odds, strategic cunning to go for speed or purity, and bit of luck to see them through. Each successive round gets more tense as points are accumulated to determine the winner.

Name: Towers & Turrets
Description:
Welcome young peasant! Towers & Turrets is a strategic tower-building card game that allows you to compete against other players to build the tallest, purest, and coolest towers your kitchen table has ever seen. But be careful young peasant. Other players are out to get you!

In this 2-5 players game you strategically build and defend your towers while attacking those of other players. Points are scored by completing towers. The taller the tower and the more pure the building materials the higher points gained. Be the first to 100 points to win.

—description from the publisher

Name: Good Question!
Description:
The goal of Good Question! is to prompt your Alexa-enabled device (not included) to say the word on your card without saying the word yourself.
 Play consists of questions from five categories of cards like “5 Second Shout,” “Streak,” or “Impossibles.” Players may ask questions such as: “Alexa, what are synonyms for cross-country?” or “Alexa, who sings Hound Dog?” and get Alexa to say the word on the card.

Every time Alexa says the word on your card, move one space forward on the board. Be the first player to make it all the way around the board and to become the Good Question Master! Good Question! is a party game for two to six players.

—description from the publisher

Name: Necromunda: House of Artifice
Description:
Necromunda is a vast machine and the sons and daughters of House Van Saar are its engineers. While other clans and Noble Houses have been content to embrace the slavish traditions of the Imperium, in particular its superstitious fear of technology, those of House Van Saar have sought to unravel the mysteries of Humanity’s lost age of advancement and progress. At times during their long history, their actions have brought them close to tech-heresy, and only the extreme secrecy of their Archeotek cabals and the benevolence of House Helmawr – which benefits most from their innovation – have protected them.

Get the ultimate guide to House Van Saar. This 128-page book features the definitive history of the House and rules for fielding the six different types of fighters available to House Van Saar – Primes, Augmeks, Archeoteks, Neoteks, Teks, and Subteks. It's ideal for fans of House Van Saar or anyone who wants to delve deeper into the dark side of the underhive.

Inside this book, you'll find:

• History of the House of Artifice

• House Van Saar Gangs: Updated rules for creating and running House Van Saar gangs, including two new Van Saar gang fighters - the technological Archeoteks and the grav-cutter riding Neoteks.

• Hired Guns, Hangers-on, and Dramatis Personae: Rules for adding Bounty Hunters, Hive Scum, and House Agents to your game, as well as Van Saar specific Dramatis Personae such as Von Buren (the rogue Archeotek) and Lisbeth "Iron Angel" (the arachni-rig pilot).

• Expanded Rules: Additional rules for running House Van Saar gangs.

• House Van Saar Scenarios: A collection of scenarios dedicated to the House of Artifice.

Name: Warhammer Age of Sigmar: Warcry – Tome of Champions 2020
Description:
The Tome of Champions 2020 is an essential companion to Warcry, no matter how you like to play. From new narrative content to twists for matched play and fresh open play game modes, it’s packed with updated rules and ideas to inspire you. Monstrous melees and incredible quests await.
Inside this book, you'll find:

• Rules for embarking on a deadly Trial of Champions campaign or battling multiple rival warbands in brutal Pit Fights

• A campaign system in which you explore the city of Soroth Kor, featuring expanded territory rules and treasures to be discovered

• New lesser artefact tables specific to each Grand Alliance

• Cooperative challenge battles against deadly wild fighters

A copy of the Warcry Core Book is necessary to use the contents of this book.

Name: Adeptus Titanicus: Crucible of Retribution
Description:
When the Horus Heresy broke out, the galaxy fell into turmoil. In the Belt of Iron, an area characterised by a preponderance of forge worlds, long-held grievances turned into outright war between Mechanicum factions, and the Titan Legions aligned with the various forge world marched in defence of their allies…

Discover the dramatic events of the Cataclysm of Iron, when forge world fought forge world, in this 96-page hardback supplement for Adeptus Titanicus. Harness the strengths of seven different Titan Legions using two new maniples, and bring the might of four Knight Households to bear against your enemies. Play out the story across four narrative missions – or create your own with new Echoes of Glory rules that provide you with powerful tools to play your games in whatever manner you choose.

Inside this book you will find:

• An overview of the Cataclysm of Iron campaign

• Background and Legion-specific rules for seven Titan Legions: Atarus, Astraman, Ignatum, Venator, Laniaskara, Kulesaetai, Damicium, and Tritonis

• Two new maniples to use in your games

• Background and rules for four Knight Houses: Col'Khak, Moritain, Gotrith, and Vextrix

• Full colour examples of paint schemes and heraldry for Titans and Knights

• Four narrative missions based on the dramatic events of the story

• Echoes of Glory rules for creating your own missions across five mission types and three world types
Families: Game: Adeptus Titanicus – The Horus Heresy (Games Workshop)

Name: Warhammer Age of Sigmar: Warcry – Catacombs: Board Pack
Description:
Explore haunted ruins, mind-bending labyrinths, profane temples, and infernal forges as you quest for glory – but beware, for death is always waiting in the shadows to claim the unworthy…

Test your tactical skills and try new, thematically rich battlefields in Warcry with this board set! Designed to work with Warcry: Catacombs, each of these boards offers a thrilling new set of opportunities. Brave the twisting Lair of the Sphiranx, fight in the tight confines of the Cinder Warrens, dominate the centre ground in Halls of Velorum, and weave between the columns of the Temple of Nagendra – combined with the Warcry: Catacombs set, this promises hours of fun and variety.

This set contains two double-sided 760mm x 568mm game boards, plus a booklet with tips and rules for adding them to your games. Please note – you'll need a copy of Warcry: Catacombs to make use of this set.

—description from the publisher

Name: Black Rose Wars: Black Lymph Promo Card
Description:
Look at the Forgotten Spells deck, choose 1 card and add it to your hand. Gain 1 PP.

-or-

Lose 2 PP. Destroy the Black Rose Room and take its room token.

Name: Fallen knight: Ghazhel mournhide
Description: Weakest and smallest one of his kind. Once upon meeting cursed children, they begged Ghazhel to devour them to end their suffering. He accepted and devoured them all. Even tough Ghazhel mournhide accuired tremondous power from the curse , children are still suffering and crying on his back.

Name: Digest No. 1 for Ultra Modern Army Lists and Organisations
Description:
Includes:


     Complete update for the Ultra Modern Army Lists
     18 New Armies
     Complete points values for Challenger Rules
     Clarifications for Challenger Rules

Name: Implo
Description:
Implo is a finite territory game for two players: Black and White. It is played on the intersections (points) of an initially empty square grid (board). The recommended board sizes are between 6×6 and 10×10 points. Each player must have access to a sufficient number of stones and markers of their own color.

				
				
					DefinitionsIn these rules, "adjacent" always means "orthogonally adjacent".

A group is a piece along with all other pieces one could reach from it through a series of steps between identical adjacent pieces. Thus, all pieces in a group are the same type (stone or marker) and color (black or white).

The size of a group is the number of pieces in it.

Likewise, a territory is an empty point along with all other points one could reach from it through a series of steps between adjacent empty points.

A patch is a territory including at most four points.

The owner of a patch is the player with the biggest group of stones adjacent to it. If there is no such group or the biggest such groups of both colors are the same size, the owner of the patch is the opponent of the player who placed the last stone on the board.

To resolve a patch is to place a marker of its owner's color on each of its points and to remove the biggest group of stones which is adjacent to the patch and owned by the same player as the patch. If several such groups are tied for biggest, the player who is resolving the patch removes, among those, one of their choosing. If there are no groups of stones adjacent to the patch, no group is removed. Note the player resolving the patch need not be the owner of the patch.

				
				
					PlayBlack plays first, then turns alternate. On your turn, perform these actions in order:

1. Place a stone of your color on an empty point of the board.

2. Resolve any single patch on the board.

3. Repeat the previous step until no patches remain. Note the order of resolving matters, and resolving a patch may create new patches.

If, at the end of a player's turn, there are no empty points on the board, the game ends. The winner is the player with more groups of markers of the largest size of which there is an unequal number of black and white groups of markers. If there is a tie, whoever has more stones on the board wins. If this is also tied (only possible on even-sized boards), whoever made the last move loses.

To make the game fair, White will have the option, on their first turn only, to swap sides with Black instead of making a regular move.

Name: Timmy im Zoo
Description:
New adventure with Timmy: He goes to the zoo and it is time to feed the animals! Together with Timmy, the players visit the different enclosures and feed the animals with their favourite food. The doublesided game board with a 3D structure offers both a land and a water side full of cute, child-friendly illustrations.

The game board of Timmy im Zoo is embedded in the bottom of the box and shows four different animals waiting to be fed with their mouths open. Each player has a matching food piece for each animal. The dice decide which food may be fed - of course only to the right animal. The first player to distribute all his food to the animals first wins the game.

Name: Festive Trivia Quiz
Description: The game comes with a deck of fifty cards, each containing one Christmas-themed question, and an instruction sheet. In turn, each player is asked the question on the top card of the deck. A player keeps the card for scoring purposes when giving the correct response to the question. Cards answered incorrectly go to the bottom of the deck. The first player to score five correct answers is the winner.

Name: Trapped: The Carnival
Description:
Escape Room Game Pack
Series 1, Room 3
Difficulty level: EASY

TRAPPED turns any room into a family-friendly escape-room adventure...  In The Carnival, it's your lifelong dream to work alongside the fabled fortune teller and jaw-dropping performers of Muggins Carnival...  Soon after you apply, The Ringmaster invites you to an interview you'll never forget!

Nothing's what it seems as you perform the admission tests: a series of baffling puzzles and mysteries.  Race head-to-head with your friends and family to see who'll be crowned King or Queen of the Carnival.

Carnival is less an “escape” room, and more a series of puzzles that exist just for the fun of it. There is no clear progression of the game, with an end goal of escaping. But rather the goal is to solve the Ringmaster’s puzzles and be awarded points. How you choose to play, is up to you, however. You may choose to split into teams (or individuals) and solve all of the puzzles, competing for the best score.

-description from the publisher's website

Name: Pâtée Impériale
Description:
Pâtée Impériale is a game of strategy cards, combinations and memory to be played individually or in teams of two.

Form the best suite of courtiers in order to obtain the most prestige points and get noticed by the emperor.

Each player starts with an equal number of cards in hand. Players take turns choosing a card and performing the described action.

At the end of 3 rounds, you should have accumulated the most prestige points than your opponents to win the game.

Name: Star Wars: Legion – Lando Calrissian Commander Expansion
Description:
A smooth talking scoundrel and gambler, Lando Calrissian likes to keep his allegiance close to his chest. But when the chips are down and the galaxy is at stake, he sides with the freedom fighters of the Rebel Alliance. From captain of the Millennium Falcon to Administrator of Cloud City, no leadership role Calrissian has taken on is as important as Rebel general and he brings all this experience to the battles of Star Wars: Legion.

This expansion contains everything you need to add Lando Calrissian as a commander of your Rebel armies, beginning with a beautifully sculpted, unpainted hard plastic miniature that reflects Calrissian’s unique sense of style. Not only will you find three different options for his signature cape, you’ll also be able to choose between two facial expressions and whether or not Calrissian appears reaching for his X-8 Night Sniper Pistol in its holster or has it at the ready.

While the miniature gives Calrissian a unique presence on the battlefield, other components, like his unit card and three signature command cards, represent his history as a gambler and his tendency to take high stakes risks. Finally, Lando Calrissian isn’t one to enter a fight unprepared, and this expansion also includes six upgrade cards that give him access to the gear and training he needs to take on any challenge.

—description from the publisher

Name: Star Wars: Legion – Agent Kallus Commander Expansion
Description:
Feared both within and without the Imperial ranks, the Imperial Security Bureau scours the galaxy for any disloyal to the Empire. Agent Kallus is one of the ISB's most effective agents, using his cunning and combat prowess to snuff out the spark of rebellion at its source.

This expansion invites you to put this ruthless agent in command of your Imperial army, beginning with a highly customizable, unpainted hard plastic Agent Kallus miniature that reflects his status as a ruthless Imperial agent. In addition to choosing between two facial expressions for your miniature, you'll also be able to assemble your Agent Kallus with the trademark Imperial Security Bureau helmet or with no helmet at all. Finally, Agent Kallus is deadly up close and with a blaster and you can choose whether he appears with his signature J-19 Bo-Rifle in its blaster or staff forms.

While these features project Kallus' status as a relentless ISB agent, his unit card clearly outlines all of his abilities and his three signature command cards reflect his capacity to shape your strategy. Despite all of his skills, Kallus is still susceptible to sympathizing with his enemies, a weakness that is reflected in Flaw card included with this expansion. Finally, Agent Kallus carefully calculates what he'll need for each battle and seven upgrade cards invite you to choose the gear and training that best fits your battle plan.

—description from the publisher

Name: Nonexistent Game
Description: This game is nonexistent.  It should not appear anywhere outside of BoardGameGeek.com.  This is proprietary data not to be used by any entity outside of BoardGameGeek.com.

Name: Icetoids
Description:
Be the first to position your 3 pieces on the 3 tiles that display the icon of your color.  16 tiles.

Players launch their pyramids from an edge base, can move 1, or can move in the direction of an arrow on a tile.  You may also be able to push another player's piece.

Name: Sjónarspil 18+
Description: An expansion for the base game, for players 18 and older. A deck of cards with adjectives which can be used to describe players, as in the base game.

Name: Escape to Nowhere: Army Group South, December 1943-April 1944
Description:
"Escape to Nowhere: Army Group South, December 1943- April 1944" uses 16-mile hexes and army and corps units-of-maneuver to cover the liberation of the Ukraine and the Crimea by the Red Army at that time.

Designed by Ty Bomba using the same alternating-actions system as the earlier game "Codeword Thunderclap: Army Group Don, November 1942 – March 1943".

Published in Command Magazine Japan #156. December 2020.

Name: ヒ秘 (Baboons)
Description:
ãƒ’ç§˜ (Baboons) is a memory game from Japan, with players leading their troops of baboons across the Savannah. In Japanaese ãƒ’ç§˜ means 'secret'.

The Savannah is a 4*4 tableau of face-down tiles, which might be food or water, or hazards such as cobras, leopards, or rival baboons. The players start their baboon leader in a corner and move up to three spaces. After looking at a face-down tile, a player can mark it, and must remember what the marking was for.

Each player has a small board showing the size and health of their troop. The players are trying to get their troop to be the largest by the end of the game.

During the game, a player might turn up a sunset, which ends the round. The game ends on a fifth sunset.

There are also wildfires on the Savannah, and these cause tiles to be replaced. Players must contend with their own memories and changes to the tableau.

Name: An Unpleasant and Devastating Fight: The Battle For the Sittang Bridge February 21-22, 1942
Description:
“We arrived at Mokpalin, from the south…There were masses of troops but no staffs… We were at the south of the railway station but west of the line, and throughout the day the Japs were attacking on the other side of the line… After a bit the Kawkareik Brigadier turned up… and really did get things organized. We were very glad to see him. We were to form a box round Mokpalin, we being in the S.W. corner.” –Officer of the 8th Burma Rifles about the battle for the Sittang Bridge.

The situation for the Allies in Burma was increasingly desperate following the Japanese invasion that began in December 1941. After nearly a month of fighting the British Dominion forces were in full retreat, hoping to meet with reinforcements being rushed to the theater and to regroup behind the Sittang River. Key to this goal was the successful withdrawal of the Indian 17th Division. That division had been engaged in a running fight with the Japanese 33rd (214th and 215th Regiments) and 55th (143rd Regiment) Divisions from the outset of the invasion. Both sides converged on the only major bridge over the Sittang river north of Rangoon, a railway span near the town of Sittang.  An Allied success here could potentially thwart the Japanese offensive and save Rangoon. Another victory for the Japanese could lead to the capture of that major port and even more conquests by the sons from the land of the Rising Sun.

Each copy of An Unpleasant and Devastating Fight is composed of the following:

One 11 by 17 inch hex map
One sheet of 70 double-sided, unmounted counters
8 pages of rules

Infantry units are battalions, all other units are companies. A hex is approximately 800 yards across. Each turn represents six hours of time. Players will need a standard deck of playing cards and a six-sided die to play the game. A custom card set that replaces the standard deck of playing cards is also available.

An Unpleasant and Devastating Fight is designed by Paul Rohrbaugh and features graphics by Ilya Kudriashov.

-description from designer

Name: St. Augustine-opoly
Description:
St. Augustine-opoly is a version of the game Monopoly about the city of St. Augustine

In this roll-and-move property trading game, properties are St Augustine favorite locations such as: Alligator Farm, Castillo de San Marcos, The Fountain of Youth, and of course, the St. Augustine Lighthouse...

Players pay money when they land on each other's properties, and the goal is to bankrupt your opponents.

Name: Domesday (COIN)
Description:
Domesday is a board game that adapts the COIN Series developed by GMT Games to the Norman Conquest of England. Players control the Norman, Saxon, Viking, and Scots/Welsh Factions and use Events, Commands and Special Abilities to place and move leaders and pieces on the map to control areas, gain support, and win victory.

Edward the Confessor returned from exile in Normandy after decades of Viking rule in 1042 to become king of England. Magnus the Good of Norway also claimed the throne, and threatened war, but was dissuaded by the childless Edward, who promised to make him his heir. Edward gave the same promise to Sweyn Estridsson of Denmark, William of Normandy, and Harold Godwinson. When he died in 1066 four powerful warlords claimed to be his rightful heir. It would not end well.

Cards are drawn from the deck one at time, with one card in play and the following card face up on top of the deck. Each Event card shows the order in which Eligible Factions may choose to resolve the Event or one of their own Commands, sometimes with one of their Special Abilities. Resolving an Event or Command makes the Faction Ineligible for the next card. Crown Events interrupt play as a King is crowned, Victory is determined, Revenue is collected, and Support is expanded.

-description from designer

Name: Collapse!
Description: Collapse! is a scenario for Next War: Korea included with C3i #27 that features streamlined air combat and an updated sequence of play on four pages and two double-sided play aids.

Name: 1914: Twilight in the East – Dragoni Variant
Description:
Hypothetical variant for "Dragoni's plan for Austro-Hungarian victory in 1914".

4 page set-up folder, 2 page rules changes and designer's notes in the magazine, 140 counters.

Included with C3i magazine #26

Name: Battles of the American Revolution: Solitaire Tactics Methods
Description:
Table play aid and rules for resolving Close Combat in the Battles of the American Revolution series when playing solitaire.

Regular PvP play has battle tactics determined in a secret selection of tactics by each player; this doesn't work for solitaire play. This accessory provides a methodology in lieu of that method.

—user summary
Families: Series: Battles of the American Revolution (GMT)

Name: Great Rolled Ones
Description:
"You and the other players are cultists attempting to summon Cthulhu and bring about the end of the world. YOu must successfully perform 50 arcane rituals, but be careful: misspeak the the strange incantations and you will suffer Cthulu's wrath!"

This is a push your luck game of dice rolling to complete rituals. Completed rituals within a run score you points, provided that you don't accumulate three 1's causing you to go insane and score nothing for the run.

You'll need paper and pencil to keep track of the score.

-description from the book, Random Fun Generator
Families: Series: Random Fun Generator (Steve Jackson Games)

Name: Bouquet
Description:
"You and the other players are floral designers, and the most popular bouquets this season incorporate a wide variety of flowers. In this game, each value on a die represents a different flower... and only the most diverse arrangements will sell for top dollar!"

This is a dice rolling game where you are locking in values, deciding if you will stop & score the locked values or continue to pushing your luck and re-roll. You bust and score nothing if you only roll locked values on the next roll. If you stopped and scored you get points; the game ends when you get to 100 points.

-description from the book, Random Fun Generator
Families: Series: Random Fun Generator (Steve Jackson Games)

Name: Flick of Faith: Santa God Promo
Description:
Snow and presents!
Santa can use Prophets and Temples of any other god currently not in the game.
Ho, ho, ho! Instead of building Temple put 3VP token on the map. You get that VP as soon as it leaves the City you put it into.

This promo was created to celebrate the Christmas of 2020.

-description from designer

Name: Swapportunity
Description:
"Each player is trying to beat the dealer in this game of dice-swapping, but if you aren't careful you might put yourself in trouble on a later turn!"

Using 3 dice, you play a game of swapping dice to beat the dealer's pair of dice. You get 3 choices - use the dice you rolled, swap a die with your locked die to improve your score, or use all 3 dice. This results in you locking one die to a 1 for the next round.

If you beat the dealer, you get a point. First one to 6 points wins.

-description from the book, Random Fun Generator
Families: Series: Random Fun Generator (Steve Jackson Games)

Name: Little Fish
Description:
"You and the other players are little fish, trying to avoid the fisherman! At the end of the round, the biggest fish get caught, and only the little fish survive. Compete in secret for the highest score, but when your results are revealed each round, the best dice on the table get tossed out."

Secretively roll your dice up to three times and try and get the most points scored with any dice not caught. The highest number on the table is caught and doesn't score.

-description from the book, Random Fun Generator
Families: Series: Random Fun Generator (Steve Jackson Games)

Name: Sink or Swim
Description:
"If we're going down, we're going down together! IN this game of doublethink, everyone contributes dice to the center, then competes for them. Use the same tactics as another player, however, you will sink!"

This simultaneous play has you rolling two dice and putting them into a pool in the center. Then you secretly set a die to what you think you want to pull from the center with each matching die equating to a point. The problem is you lose points for each matching die when another person also sets their die to that value. Set it to a value that isn't in the pool and neither gain or lose points. After 10 rounds, see who has the most points!

-description from the book, Random Fun Generator
Families: Series: Random Fun Generator (Steve Jackson Games)

Name: Frenemies
Description:
"You and your opponent are reluctant partners. Work alongside your enemy to determine the winning condition, then try to take them out!"

In this 2 player game you secretly choose a die from those that you rolled to contribute to the center. These set your winning conditions to trying to beat this pot's value with your remaining dice, equaling the value, or being lower. If you can meet the conditions you win the round! Win 5 rounds and you in the game...

-description from the book, Random Fun Generator
Families: Series: Random Fun Generator (Steve Jackson Games)

Name: Superzings: Rivals of Kaboom
Description: Roll the battle dice and determine your battle power. The highest battle power score wins the clash! Compete and defeat five times to win the game! Contents: Double-sided game board, 4 character playing pieces and stands, 4 character battle power cards, 1 unique enigma figure, 1 battle dice and instructions.

Name: Malpractice
Description:
"You and other players are all doctors of questionable skills and ethics. Score points when your patients survive, and when they don't. Will you be a hero, a monster, or both?"

You have two dice patients you are caring for... Roll their values and you can improve their health. Doubles and triples allow even more health improvement. Those you can't tend to have their health erode. If the patient die rises above six the patient scores for you and a new patient die comes in. If a die's health erodes below 1, they die and likewise get replaced.

-description from the book, Random Fun Generator
Families: Series: Random Fun Generator (Steve Jackson Games)

Name: Dragon Braggin'
Description:
"You and other players are in a tavern, boasting about who can kill the biggest dragon without getting burned. Careful, though... your opponent can chicken out and make you face the dragon instead|"

This two player game has you going back and forth deciding to take on the dragon by rolling your three dice or chickening out and forcing your opponent to roll against the dragon. Score points for beating the dragon or when your opponent loses. First to 5 points wins!

-description from the book, Random Fun Generator
Families: Series: Random Fun Generator (Steve Jackson Games)

Name: Fnord Dice
Description:
"'Everything in the universe relates to five, one way or another, given enough ingenuity on the part of the interpreter.'

- The Law of Fives, Principia Discordia"

This is played in rounds where rolling matching triples on 5 dice score points along with other matching numbers. Each player takes a turn within the round rolling and scoring. Whenever 50 points is reached the round is finished so everyone gets an equal turn and the player with the highest score wins.

-description from the book, Random Fun Generator
Families: Series: Random Fun Generator (Steve Jackson Games)

Name: Yea or Nay
Description:
"You and other players are trying to fool the dealer in this game of truth and deception. A successful bluff scores you a point, but if the dealer can see through your nonsense, they get a point instead."

The dealer rolls two dice in the open. Everyone else keeps their roll secret. Using a combination of what looks to be derived from roman voting and the dealer declaring whether there is belief or not in the declaration, points are scored. After two rounds the games ends and the winner is the one that earned the most points.

-description from the book, Random Fun Generator
Families: Series: Random Fun Generator (Steve Jackson Games)

Name: Six-Sided Slayers
Description:
"In this cooperative game, you and other players take on classic adventurer roles and charge deep into the monster's lair. Kill enough monsters and become legendary heroes! Fail too often and you become a cautionary tale..."

Each player has six dice while the rest are the dice pool representing the monster. Low valued dice are not a part of the monster. Players decide and declare what role they will be - bard, wizard, warrior, etc. Then they roll their dice. They then  remove monster dice if they can match the dice per their role's abilities. If they defeat the monster (i.e. the monster has no more dice), the group earns a point. If there are dice remaining though, the monster deals one point damage per die remaining. If the group can get 5 points before they get 5 damage points, they win. If neither of these have been hit, take another round. If the party ever gets 5 points of damage though - well, the tales told in the taverns won't be happy ones...

-description from the book, Random Fun Generator
Families: Series: Random Fun Generator (Steve Jackson Games)

Name: The Dr. Seuss 4-Game Treasury
Description:
This big game treasury contains all you need to play four fun Dr. Seuss games based on his well-known books: Cat in the Hat Game, Green Eggs and Ham Game, Dr. Seuss's ABC Game, and One fish, two fish, red fish, go fish! Card Game.
Each captures Seuss's whimsical style, memorable characters, and unique sense of humor, while teaching important early reading concepts like letter-recognition, rhyming, and word association.

—description from the publisher

Name: Marvel Heroes: Power Play! – Electronic Game Book
Description:
Join Marvel Heroes as they battle a battery of bad guys bent on taking over the world!
If you're game, then Marvel Heroes Power Play Electronic Game Book is for you! Inside, you'll find five exciting board games that put you right in the middle of the action and make you a member of the Marvel Heroes team. Just pick your Super Hero play pieces and get ready to help Spider-Man, the Fantastic Four, X-men, Avengers, and the Hulk defeat their foes.

—description from the publisher

Name: Star Arena
Description:
StarArena is an action-packed Who-Gets-To-The-Top-First_Wins!! and the physical Battle-Arena (Board-Game) to the gratuitous web-published CCG (Card-Game). What might look like a unadventurous roll, spin and move board-game on the surface, is actually an instant timeless classic due to the multiple-levels that rotate around a game-axle. This 'game-mechanic' alters the Arena-Area and Battle-Conditions, therewith things can go from Bad to Worse in an instance while the Game-Gods favor the current player, ...or not!?

The StarArena_Board-Game follows the Rules-Of-Conduct, these Area-Rules are printed on the back of the board so that they may never-get-lost! After it is decided who starts the game by 'Jan-Ken-Pon; A Game-Turn is always started by the roll of the dice! The D8 outcome gives you the amount of 'Actions' you may perform during your turn, divided into 'Turning' and/or 'Moving!'

If the Game-Gods favor you? You can use the larger number of actions gained, to turn the game board into 'Color-Advantage' and 'Level-Up' towards the Top from 'Own-Color-To-Color' without having to do: Card-Battle. If your actions are limited; You should consider spending them on forcing the next-player into Card-Combat? Since the rule is: to Enter the game _from base 'into' the arena_ you must Insert-Coin onto the top-square of the game-board named 'Sanctuary; The first player to reach the top in Card-Battle takes home the Treasure!'

Knocking other players off the game-board back-to-base in card-combat, makes them have to Re-Enter the game and Insert-Coin again, thickening the plot and pot. Thus-far the focus has been on the ROC, the surefire way to Level-Up is; Win in Card-Battle!  When you boldly claim a battle with another player, your actions are paused and the Rules-Of-Engagement are set into effect. Win your battle: You may continue your Actions +1 Level-Up! If you fail to be victorious, you loose your actions, your turn ends and your Hero remains on the last location, which could prove precarious in the next-players turn...

It is a deceptively simple game and you have to make the best of each situation, the aim of the game is: Reach Sanctuary First! Just remember; You are not the only one in the Arena with the eyes on the Prize!?

—description from the publisher

Name: Runner-Up
Description:
"Charge to the finish line right behind the player in first, but don't get eliminated by the player in third! Second place wins all!"

This dice rolling game has you comparing dice that you roll and select each round, if you match other players then you  don't score. If you wind up in second place you do! Game ends as soon as someone has collected 6 points.

-description from the book, Random Fun Generator
Families: Series: Random Fun Generator (Steve Jackson Games)

Name: No Quarter
Description:
"You are captain of a well armed ship, caught in a broadside battle against an enemy vessel captained by your opponent. As you race forward, you fire at the other ship and bark orders at your crew!"

Each round you will secretly rearrange your weakest and strongest areas amongst 3 different zones of your ship. Then you will declare what part of your opponent's ship you are targeting and roll dice. Did you get a hit? They adjust the amount of damage downwards. Did you miss entirely, then you adjust downwards. If a section of a ship goes below 1, then the ship sinks.

-description from the book, Random Fun Generator
Families: Series: Random Fun Generator (Steve Jackson Games)

Name: Poule Poule: Oka Luda Goose Card
Description:
Add the card to the animal deck.
When the Oka Luda Goose card comes into play, the foxes brood the eggs and the chicken hunt the foxes. All other animals actions remain the same.

Promo card found in Plato Magzine 129

Name: Skeet
Description:
"Blast the most targets in this silly dexterity game and win!"

This is a dice flicking game aimed at collecting cards. Whoever claims the most cards when the draw deck runs out, wins.

-description from the book, Random Fun Generator
Families: Series: Random Fun Generator (Steve Jackson Games)

Name: Deadly Dig
Description:
"You and the other players are all treasure hunters, exploring a dark and deadly crypt. Each step into the crypt will be more valuable, but also more dangerous!"

This is a six round game to attempt to get treasure. You choose whether to continue or not gaining treasure along the way. If you choose to go back (or get through 6 turns of rolling winning each time), you score the dice you collected. If you get chased back, you lose all the treasure that round.

-description from the book, Random Fun Generator
Families: Series: Random Fun Generator (Steve Jackson Games)

Name: Hexican Train
Description:
"In this dice-based twist on a classic dominoes game, players use pairs of dice to create a long train. Get stuck with dice at the end, however, and your game will derail quickly!"

You have a dice 'bone pile' that you play from adding to the dealer's lead pair, treating the dice pair as a domino. Each person in turn tries to connect a pair or pass, when everyone passes the round is over and remaining dice score against you. Once someone gets to 10 points the winner is determined.

-description from the book, Random Fun Generator
Families: Series: Random Fun Generator (Steve Jackson Games)

Name: Animal Marche
Description:
Fountain square located in the center of the city.
The player is the owner of the shop facing the square.
Let's attract as many customers as possible, earn income, and further develop the store!

The main flow of the game is to call in the customer in front of your store. When everyone calls in, you will get coins and wood according to the number of customers. Then you can use your employees to build or renovate your store.

After 5 rounds, and the player with the most points wins. Scores can be earned by achieving the personal goal card, constructing public buildings, and etc.

Name: Three-Legged Race
Description:
"Maintain a careful balance as you chase three high scores at once!"

This one is a bit of a math at the end where you are trying to optimize the summed difference of scores to be the closest to 50 across three scoring columns. Each person is working to do this.

The game can be played in turns or simultaneous.

-description from the book, Random Fun Generator
Families: Series: Random Fun Generator (Steve Jackson Games)

Name: Backhand
Description:
"Serve! Volley! Lob! Smash! Roll Dice to simulate hitting a tennis ball back and forth, sometimes spending more energy to make powerful shots."

This has you trying to win a set as in tennis and deciding whether you want to use a power shot or not. The power shot uses up a limited supply of energy (tracked on one die) to roll an extra die for sending a shot in...

-description from the book, Random Fun Generator
Families: Series: Random Fun Generator (Steve Jackson Games)

Name: Unreliable Flying Object
Description:
"You and the other players are members of the same spaceship crew, trying to return home. Your ship is pretty battered from the last mission, and things are constantly breaking, risking the lives of everyone aboard. Can you work together as a team to keep the ship flying, or will you die in space?"

Different parts of the ship have different durabilities. You will be rolling to prevent these durabilities from decreasing to zero, which will destroy the ship. If you can make it the number of required rounds without this happening, then you successfully got home.

-description from the book, Random Fun Generator
Families: Series: Random Fun Generator (Steve Jackson Games)

Name: Closing Bell
Description:
"In this stock market game you will invest your dice, hoping ot score big points when the market closes. Careful... you could bust and go home empty-handed!"

This game is played in rounds of 4 market phases. There is a set of market dice that are rolled secretly by keeping them under a cup. Rolling your dice and then you can choose one value to lock. Once everyone has decided, uncover the market dice. If you didn't match any of the market dice, you are now out and score nothing. Did you match an unlocked value on a market die at least once, but not the locked value? You can continue playing, but you don't score any points this round. If you match the locked dice to the market dice, you can choose to set aside these for scoring or continue to the next round to push your luck for more points.

The points scored go up each round, but the number of market dice rolled go down. Locked dice remain locked from round ot round.
Families: Series: Random Fun Generator (Steve Jackson Games)
